```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(datasauRus)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

# Resumen de los Datos
```{r resumen}
resumen <- datasaurus_dozen %>%
  group_by(dataset) %>%
  summarize(
    mean_x = mean(x),
    mean_y = mean(y),
    std_dev_x = sd(x),
    std_dev_y = sd(y),
    corr_x_y = cor(x, y)
  )

resumen
```

# Grafico de los datasets
```{r graficos, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
ggplot(datasaurus_dozen, aes(x = x, y = y, colour = dataset)) +
  geom_point(size = 1.5) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  facet_wrap(~dataset, ncol = 3)
```

# Regresión lineal Slant Down
```{r regresion_slant_down}
# Filtramos solo el dataset 'slant_down'
slant_down <- datasaurus_dozen %>% 
  filter(dataset == "slant_down")

# Ajustamos una regresión lineal simple (y ~ x)
modelo <- lm(y ~ x, data = slant_down)
```
# Gráfico
```{r grafico_slant_down, message=FALSE, fig.width=6, fig.height=5}
ggplot(slant_down, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point(color = "tomato", size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "steelblue", linewidth = 1) +
  labs(
    title = "Regresión lineal del dataset 'slant_down'",
    subtitle = "y ~ x",
    x = "x",
    y = "y"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 13)
```
